intro: Micromeria nubigena subvar. glabrescens, commonly known as the smoothleaf micromeria, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its small, aromatic leaves and yellow flowers. The subspecies glabrescens is distinguished by its smooth, hairless foliage compared to other varieties. It typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. The plant's botanical features make it an interesting subject for studies on xerophytic adaptations.
